org.jd3
Interface D3Session

All Superinterfaces:
D3Component
All Known Implementing Classes:
D3SessionTcp
public interface D3Session
extends D3Component

Interface of the session definition, use for basic operation on the server

Version:
0.8
Author:
Christophe Marchal

Method Detail

noop

public int noop()
         throws D3Exception
This function do nothing, just send instruction and receive a response. Use it to know the communication is OK
Returns:
the status of command.
  • D3_OK if the communication is OK
  • D3_ERR if not

    • call

    public int call(java.lang.String name,
                D3Params parms)
         throws D3Exception
    Call a basic subroutine
    Parameters:
    name - The name of the subroutine
  • mysub : must be cataloged in the account of the server
  • myaccount,myfile, mysub : the absolute path to the subroutine
    parms - The parameters of the subroutine

    • execute

    public java.lang.String execute(java.lang.String sentence)
                         throws D3Exception
    Execute a TCL command
    Parameters:
    sentence - The TCL command to execute

    select

    public D3SelectList select(java.lang.String sentence)
                    throws D3Exception
    Execute a select at the TCL and return the active list.
    Parameters:
    sentence - The AQL command to select key from file

    openFile

    public D3File openFile(java.lang.String pfilename)
                throws D3Exception
    Open D3 File in the account you run the server
    Parameters:
    pfilename - The file name to open. The file must be in the account where run the server, or as a Q-pointer

    openFile

    public D3File openFile(java.lang.String paccountname,
                       java.lang.String pfilename)
                throws D3Exception
    Open a D3 File in an account name
    Parameters:
    paccountname - The name of the account where is store the d3 file
    pfilename - The name of the file to open, must be in the account (or as a q-pointer)
